fullText:
Democracy Dies in DarknessReview by  Peter MarksNEW YORK — “Interveno ticketmasterus!”

I’m wondering if the wizarding world could come up with a charm that might give desperate Muggles a leg up on performance availability. Because an incantation may be the only way to scare up tickets to “Harry Potter and the Cursed Child,” now that it has officially opened on Broadway and Potterholics are going to be hitting the ticket-buying website refresh button so often they’ll be in danger of breaking keyboards and fingers.

keyPhrases.quote: Potterholics are going to be hitting the ticket-buying website refresh button so often they'll be in danger of breaking keyboards and fingers
an incantation may be the only way to scare up tickets
desperate Muggles a leg up on performance availability

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: This excerpt focuses entirely on anticipated high demand for tickets, implying the show is worth seeing, but contains no actual critical evaluation of the production's quality. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses a sense of excitement about ticket demand but lacks a clear recommendation or detailed critique of the production itself. | Note: Models differed by 15 points.
